body:
Hey!
I have the same problem, my lottie animations are running during my uitests and make them flaky. And as I set all system animation to 0, shouldn't them not be running?
For now, I need to detect that I am in a ui test and not starting the animation but it makes the code ugly and the use of lottie painful :(
Is it planned to support the system animation scale ?

After digging more into this, it looks that this commit is the culprit: https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/commit/a212bc8d8c5737a46deafb098e273937d77477b9#diff-3fed8fdab23c1f8e4ddab55a92bb30f1

Basically all logic related to disabling the animations depending on the system settings simply seems to have been removed.
@BoD @CmoaToto I can look in to re-adding this functionality. I would also accept a PR.
@CmoaToto @gpeal the merged PR does not seem to help when animation is looping - should it be covered as well?

That's correct, `animator.playAnimation()` will not be called but since `LottieAnimationView.resumeAnimation()` might have been called from another place, `setFrame((int) (getSpeed() < 0 ? getMinFrame() : getMaxFrame()))` would only set animation to last frame and then an animation repeats, isn't that right?

It seems like there should be a similar condition added to `LottieDrawable.resumeAnimation()` or maybe some place deeper like `LottieValueAnimator.postFrameCallback()`. What do you think?

I think you're right! great investigation :)
Would you take care of it? If not, I may do so in a near future...
It seems that it's actually already been done here https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/pull/1349 but not released yet :)

issue.title: Lottie animation not working for Android 10 on Version 3.0.7

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Lottie animation not working for Android 10 on Version 3.0.7 but works fine on version 3.0.0.
on Android 10, Version 3.0.7  only renders lottie json first screen  but doesn't animate. 

Testing on Essential Phone-1 with Android 10 
Lottie file used path = LottieSample/src/main/assets/lottiefiles/day_night_cycle.json

issue.title: Lottie Compose does not honor accessibility setting to not play animations.

repository.name: lottie-android
repository.description: Render After Effects animations natively on Android and iOS, Web, and React Native

issue.body:
Lottie Compose version: 4.1.0

It seems Lottie Compose plays animations even though in system accessibility settings animations have been turned off. 

In LottieDrawable.java there's the `animationsEnabled()` function that is checked in `playAnimation()` before starting the animation. I don't see a similar check in `LottieAnimation()` on Compose side. 

Related to https://github.com/airbnb/lottie-android/issues/1129
